title.narrative: Conflict Risk Reduction and Youth – 2020

description.narrative:
Direct beneficiaries: 3,411 households or 18,784 people (see project 200460).
Indirect beneficiaries: 11938 households in three woredas

Long-term Objective- The objective of this component is to empower communities and local actors to identify conflict risks, analyze and plan to advance and sustain their own initiatives for peace and security (i.e. conflict risk reduction)
Short-term Objectives- Enhance capacity of Cordaid Ethiopia staff, local CSO’s and local government staff to use the Conflict Risk Analysis tool and the Conflict Risk Reduction process. - Enable communities to implement conflict risk reduction measures, linking with resilience building interventions. - Document best practices & lessons learned, for knowledge management & learning, advocacy and acquisition.

The resilience project 200460 (Integrated soil and natural resource management to mitigate drought and enhance crop and livestock production) is being implemented in Ethiopia, by Cordaid Ethiopia, with MiN funding. The project runs from March 2019 until August 2020 (18 months). Its objective is to enhance agricultural production and reduce drought risks in Argobba Woreda (District) of Amhara region. The project has been implementing watershed-based soil and water conservation; improve access to water for crop production and improved crop varieties; improve access to pasture and fodder for livestock; and introduce renewable energy in selected communities by using an action research approach in collaboration with the University of Addis Ababa. Argobba woreda is among the poorest woredas of Amhara region, bordering Afar region. Argobba was part of the Woreda Risk Profiling Project of GFDDR (World Bank Global Facility for Disaster Risk Reduction). The area is chronically food insecure with degraded farmland and grazing lands. The local economy is based on staple crops and livestock. The main income source is agricultural production (crops and livestock). However, the local economy is constrained by poor production, drought and conflict. There are local conflicts in the area due to access to rangeland, farmland and water, which are aggravated by climate change. Thus, there is a need to analyze and address conflict risks in the project area. Conflict and related displacement diminish people’s capacity to cope with natural disaster risks, whilst government capacity to adequately address people’s needs is weak. We therefore enhance and link the capacities of local communities, governments and other actors to conduct conflict risk analysis and plan conflict risk reduction measures. Cordaid Ethiopia has piloted a Triple Nexus approach by responding to the needs of the communities in Dheka-Suftu Woreda (as part of the RESET II project), which transcend humanitarian-development-peacebuilding silos. This Argobba Area add-on project component also benefits from lessons learned from this pilot Triple Nexus approach. Cordaid Ethiopia, with support from the Global Office Resilience Team proposes to have an add-on component to project 200460. The goal of this add-on component is to empower communities and local actors to identify risks, analyze and plan to advance and sustain their own initiatives for peace and security. This will be achieved through improving capacity among local and woreda level stakeholders to undertake or participate in community or organizational processes that promote conflict transformation, human security, peacebuilding and culture of peace principles, concepts and approaches.

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH

title.narrative: Peace Thematic Indicators
Number of communities capacitated to improve local security and justice situation
Sustainable Livelihoods Thematic Indicators
Number of communities reached
Number of Resilience Action Plans developed at community/local level

description.narrative: Number of communities which have been supported by Cordaid and/or partners and developed joint action plans to enhance resilience at the community/local level

title.narrative: Number of communities implementing Resilience measures

description.narrative: Number of targeted communities which have been supported by Cordaid and/or partners and (raise funds for and) carry out their action plans by implementing resilience interventions at the community/ local level

title.narrative: Sustainable Livelihoods Project Specific Indicators
Number of Participatory Conflict Risk Analyisis done at community level
Number of Community Peacebuilding Committees (CPC) established
Number of CSO/NGOs able to facilitate Participatory Conflict Risk Reduction (CRA) process
Number of communities engaged in participatory Conflict risk analysis and joint CRR and resilience action planning, at local level
Empowerment
Number of people who have participated in formal and informal decision-making directly influencing aspects of their lives

description.narrative: Number of people indicating they participated in formal and informal decision-making directly influencing aspects of their lives, comparing from before Cordaid/partner interventions to after (baseline to endline).

title.narrative: Number of (formal & informal) structural spaces maintained, created and/or strengthened

description.narrative: Number of structural spaces - both formal and informal - for participatory and inclusive democratic dialogue between local stakeholders maintained, created and/or strengthened; to be measured by comparing Contextual Analysis from before Cordaid/partner interventions to after (baseline to endline)

title.narrative: Peace Corporate Indictors
Number of people that meaningfully engage in peace processes at various levels

description.narrative: Count (or estimate if precise count not possible) number of project beneficiaries (constituencies) directly engaged in peace processes supported by the project. Their meaningful engagement needs to be analysed and supported by evidence like documented positive outcomes, satisfaction surveys results or other proof of having a voice in the peace process. Include in comments whether count or estimation, if estimation include a description of how that estimate was calculated).

title.narrative: Number of security and justice institutions (formal and informal) strengthened to provide better security and justice services

description.narrative: Count institutions supported by the project in improving their functioning resulting in better service provision towards vulnerable groups. Justice institutions can be part of the formal justice system or implement informal, customary law. Security institution include police, armed forces or peacekeeping missions. Institutions can operate at national level like Departments of Ministries or at local level like police stations and local courts. Specify in the comments which institutions have strengthened their capacities. Institutions are considered "strengthened" if they have become more responsive, accountable and inclusive.

title.narrative: Number of People effectively participating in decision-making processes on security, and justice at local level

description.narrative: Count number of project beneficiaries (constituencies) engaged in local decision making processes on security and justice supported by the project. Their effective participation needs to be analysed and supported by evidence like documented positive outcomes, satisfaction surveys results or other proof of influencing outcomes.

title.narrative: Sustainable Livelihoods Corporate Indicators
Number of beneficiaries reached (SU)

description.narrative: Number of people who have benefitted (directly or indirectly) through a Cordaid Sustainable Livelihoods Intervention
